labels.analysis: The MagicSlides Server specializes in generating professional PowerPoint presentations from various inputs such as text, YouTube videos, or structured JSON data. It offers customization options for slide count, images, language, templates, and output formats. The available tools allow for easy creation of presentations and retrieval of YouTube transcripts to aid in content generation. This server primarily solves the problem of quickly and efficiently creating professional presentations from either pre-existing content or transcrips, making it highly useful for business, educational, or personal use cases.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of generating presentations from text or media aligns most closely with the "Content Creation" category, as it involves creating, editing, and refining presentation materials. The ability to interact with YouTube for transcribing videos also relates to "Web Search & Research" as it involves gathering and repurposing online content. The server's integration with AI assistants further supports its role in automating content generation.

tools.name: create_ppt_from_text
tools.description: Generate a PowerPoint from text or YouTube URL

tools.name: get_youtube_transcript
tools.description: Fetch transcript from a YouTube video URL

server_info_crawled.overview: Generate professional PowerPoint presentations from text, YouTube videos, or structured JSON data. Customize slide count, images, language, templates, and output formats to suit your needs. Integrate seamlessly with AI assistants to create presentations on any topic efficiently.

tools.name: create_ppt_from_text
tools.description: Generate a PowerPoint from text or YouTube URL

tools.name: get_youtube_transcript
tools.description: Fetch transcript from a YouTube video URL

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@IndianAppGuy/magicslide-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
